title: Overall [0â€“4]
stimulusHtml:
Scoring Criteria (Score Scale 0-4)

4 Correctly identifies the slide on the LEFT as the earlier work. Compares or contrasts at least three distinct elements that support the choice. Both images are equally discussed. There are no significant errors.

3 Correctly identifies the slide on the LEFT as the earlier work. Compares or contrasts at least two distinct elements that support the choice. Discussion may be weighted more heavily to one work than the other. May contain some errors.

OR

Incorrectly identifies the earlier work. Correctly compares and contrasts three issues supporting the correct choice. No significant errors.

2 Correctly identifies the slide on the LEFT as the earlier work. Compares or contrasts at least one element that supports the choice. Discussion may focus mainly one work and may contain some errors.

OR

Incorrectly identifies the earlier work. Correctly compares and contrasts two issues. May be significant errors.

1 Correctly identifies the slide on the LEFT as the earlier slide but there is no other response of merit.

OR

Incorrectly identifies the slide on the right as the earlier slide, but makes an attempt to articulate at least one element that differentiates early and high Renaissance art, despite incorrect identification.

0 Makes an attempt, but the answer is without merit because it rewrites the question or makes only incorrect statements.

OR

Incorrectly identifies the earlier work. Correctly compares and contrasts two issues. May be significant errors.

OR

Incorrectly identifies the earlier work. Correctly compares and contrasts three issues supporting the correct choice. No significant errors.
